result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas M. Blahnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Along with a mental evaluation w/any necessary followup

for one year.  Discharge is scheduled for 4/20/18 or upon full payment of court obligations.

Defendant Douglas M. Blahnik in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent is present in court Kylie Beyer.  Case called appearances given.  Court quashes the warrant.  Probation is requesting to extend for one year.  Deft objects to the extension.  Court addresses the probation agent.  Court addresses the deft.  Court rules to extend for one year.  If costs are paid before the one year probation can be terminated.
of Return of November 30, 2016 Envelope

Defendant Douglas M. Blahnik not in court.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft does not appear but Probation agent Wendy Schmidt is present in court.  The deft is no longer in the Lincoln County Jail.  Probation agent informs the court that Mr Blahnik did have knowledge of this hearing.  State request that the court tolls the running of the time limits for probation time and a bench warrant for the deft.  Court grants the request.

Contact Agent Wendy Schmidt if Blahnik is picked up.
Hearing on December 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

of disagreement after December 15, 2015 proceedings
Affidavit of Disagreement After December 15, 2015 Proceedings
New probation case form.
Special Response - Notice and Demand and Affidavit of need for help - defense; The 7 elements of jurisdiction
Court reads verdict of guilty  Court decides to poll the jury.

Defendant, Douglas M. Blahnik appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft makes a statement to the court.  Deft challenges the jurisdation of the court.  This issue is taken up in the court.  Arguements made.

Court addresses the parties.  No motion from the deft to challenge the jurisdation of the court.  Court rules to deny the deft for lack of jurisdiction  Deft files with the court and gives copy to the State for seven elements.    Deft states he needs counsel.  Court addresses the issue of counsel.  Court gives reasons and  rules on counsel for the deft - deft has forfeited right to counsel for the jury trial.  Officer Brad Becker  duly sworn and testifies.  id'd the deft in the gallery.  Doug Blahnik leaves the counsel table.  Court address the deft in the gallery regarding if he could hear.  He did answer the judge so the judge took that as he could hear in the courtroom.  State moves the court to answer the question his answers are non response and should be strikes. Court grants.    Deft has no questions.  Court will allow any statements made by the deft while being taken into custody due to the warrant.

10:12 am recalled - jurors brought in  selection complete at 11:05 am.

Back on the record at 11:17 am  Preliminary jury instructions were attempted to give to the deft, he would not accept them and they were then placed on the deft table.   State makes record that the deft was invited to be part of the trial and to do this needs to be in front of the rail. Juror brought in at 11:20 am.  The court reads the preliminary jury instructions.    11:27 am State makes an opening statement.  Deft will not step in front of the rail.  No opening statement given by the deft.  Notebooks handed out to the jurors.   Brad Becker duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft  Deft will not participate with the questioning of Officer Becker.  11:46 am State Rests  Jurors excused at 11:47 am.  Court advises the deft as to what the State rests means.  Deft informs the court that he cannot participate.  Jurors back in the courtroom at 11:49 am.  Court lets the jurors break for lunch and are directed to return at 1:00 pm.  Court hands out the preliminary jury instructions and places on the table.

Case recalled at 1:06 pm  State is OK with jury instructions.  Deft will not participate in the trial.  Detective Gartman offers the deft  the instructions, deft refuses the instructions.  They are place back on the deft table.  Jurors in the courtroom at 1:10 pm.  Court to read the instructions.  1:19 pm State makes closing arguement.  Court addresses the deft and will not make a closing statement.  Jury went out at 1:30 pm deliberate.  Jurors reached a verdict at 1:37 pm  Jurors are excused at 1:40 pm

Court to sentence at this time.  
Court orders:
12 months probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Along with a mental evaluation w/any necessary followup
  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
Bond to remain in-force until he complies with probation.
2 days sentence credit

Defendant, Douglas M. Blahnik appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status given of the two cases.  15CM76 and 15CM97.  Jury trial is set for 9/29/15 and is pro se.  Arguements heard on jurisdiction of the court.  Court advises the deft how to obtain an attorney and what all the steps are.  Court to adjourn the jury trial to allow time for the deft to get an attorney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:00 am.
